an5.83:1: "Bhikkhus, possessing five qualities, an elder bhikkhu is displeasing and disagreeable to his fellow monks and is neither respected nor esteemed by them. What five? He is a schemer, a flatterer, a hinter, a belittler, and one who pursues gain with gain.[n.09]Kuhako ca hoti, lapako ca, nemittiko ca, nippesiko ca, lābhena ca lābhaṁ nijigīsitā. These are forms of wrong livelihood, discussed more fully at Vibh 352–53 (Be §§86–65); they are elaborated at Vism 23–30, Ppn .6–82.Possessing these five qualities … nor esteemed by them.
an5.83:2: "Bhikkhus, possessing fiveotherqualities, an elder bhikkhu is pleasing and agreeable to his fellow monks and is respected and esteemed by them. What five? He is not a schemer, a flatterer, a hinter, a belittler, or one who pursues gain with gain. Possessing these five qualities … and esteemed by them."
